title: Top 10 NutritionFacts.org Videos of 2020
paragraphs: NutritionFacts.org arises from my annual review of the medical literature. With the help of a team of hundreds of volunteers, we churned through tens of thousands of papers published in the peer-reviewed scientific nutrition literature and are ramping up to break new records in 2021. How do I choose which studies to highlight? In general, I strive to focus on the most groundbreaking, interesting, and useful findings; but which topics resonate the most? The practical ones, offering cooking or shopping tips? Or those that dissect the studies behind the headlines? Maybe it's the geeky science ones exploring the wonderfully weird world of human biology? As you can see from the below list, the answer seems to be a bit of all of the above.
#10 Stainless Steel or Cast Iron: Which Cookware Is Best? Is Teflon Safe?
This was the second in a three-video series on cookware. The first was Are Aluminum Pots, Bottles, and Foil Safe?.
What about pressure cooking? I covered that in Does Pressure Cooking Preserve Nutrients?.
Other popular practical videos of 2020 included Are Ancient Grains Healthier? and Are Pre-Cut Vegetables Just as Healthy?.

My What Are the Best Foods? video was also popular last year. I would certainly consider flax seeds and all the other foods on the Daily Dozen to be among the best.
#5 Are BCAA (Branched Chain Amino Acids) Healthy?
This may help explain some of the benefits of plant-based proteins. I imagine I'll explore this topic more in my next book, How Not to Age, on the latest in longevity research.
#4 Foods That Help Headache and Migraine Relief

#3 Eat More Calories in the Morning to Lose Weight
It's not just what we eat, but when! Other popular chronobiology videos in 2020 were How Circadian Rhythms Affect Blood Sugar Levels and The Benefits of Early Time-Restricted Eating.
